title: game ruined by kindred
body: I played a couple of games with my friend who loves to play garen, course we meet a kindred player. we were playing normally until lvl 6 and then my friend started complaining to me that kindred wasn't leaving his lane. I was asking kndred for him to leave but she just stood.  Just as my friend was about to secure a kill with his ult, kindred ulted him. He was so surprised because he knew nothing about this ability and when i explained he felt cheated. this persisted throughout that game and into the next as we were on the same team again. my friend and I both agreed that this targeted instant ultimate should not be part of the game. Perhaps making it single target is an option.

replies.body: Nope it is perfectly balanced. The ult can be used for trolling but so can other champions ults so it's nothing new. If it only affected the kindred's team than it would be broken but since it affects both it isn't. If it were single target it would be a worse Kayle ult.
look at {{champion:432}} at first the troll was good in this one and {{champion:34}} are that is fun and my fave {{champion:12}}

I personally have never met any of these champs with troll players controlling them after playing way more games against or with them, on only my first two games playing with kindred, I instantly feel anger towards her ult.

And I have yet to come across a troll Kindred, but have encountered troll Bards and Anivias (not yet Ali though). Just because you haven't encountered something doesn't mean it's not around. If you're arguing that any champ that can interact with their team is troll and should be banned because of it that's a long list. {{champion:34}} {{champion:432}} {{champion:223}} {{champion:429}}  etc.. and there's even more that can still screw you over like Ali and Vayne if they wanted. That aside, mistakes happen too, Kindred is brand new, hardly anyone is gonna know when to use and when not to use her ult, just as I'm sure someone who'd never played Bard before would.
if some one ses they will go adc {{champion:69}} then il just troll

I can see this being a viable counter ult for enemy reset champs and saving the ADC, but is it really worth denying all melee\reset champions on your team? this ult practically has no benefits in a solo queue match.
Tanking towers, stalling dragon + Baron, and ulting a team fight where everyone who's important is long ranged are the main benefits in solo queue when teams aren't pre determined
